org.kepler.provenance

Class Recording

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.kepler.provenance.Recording
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    OpenProvenanceModelXML, SimpleFiringRecording, SQLRecording, TextFileRecording, WorkflowRunManagerRecording, XMLRecording

    public class Recording
extends java.lang.Object
    The provenance recorder uses the API provided by this class to write provenance information. This base class does not store the provenance data, but should be sub-classed to record it to a specific medium. For examples, see SQLRecording, and TextFileRecording. The API roughly consists of three parts: specification, evolution, and execution.

    The workflow structure, or specification, is recorded using the regNNN() methods. specificationStart() and specificationStop() are called before and after workflow structure is recorded.

    FIXME this is not all implemented An evolution is a group of changes to the workflow structure. evolutionStart() and evolutionStop() are called before and after each change or group of changes to the workflow. A change may be one of:

    • Addition to the workflow: the corresponding regNNN() method in the Specification interface is called.
    • Removal from the workflow: the remove() or removeLink() method in this interface is called.
    • Rename a NamedObj in the workflow:
    • Parameter value change: regParameter() in Specification is called.

    When a workflow executes, methods are called for actors firing, ports reading and writing, and if an error occurs. executionStart() and executionStop() are called before and after execution.

    Author:
    Daniel Crawl

    • Method Detail

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
                throws RecordingException
        Stop recording. Called when the Recording type changes or the provenance recorder is removed from canvas. NOTE: this is NOT called when the GUI exits or when the workflow runs from the command line. This is the last method called to a Recording instance.
        Throws:
        RecordingException

      • regParameter

        public boolean regParameter(NamedObj parameter)
                     throws RecordingException
        Register a parameter. A parameter can be anything stored in the MoML that does not have its own regNNN() method. This can be user-level parameters (e.g., Parameter, StringParameter, etc.) or internal to Kepler (e.g., _location, semanticType000, etc.). (A "parameter" corresponds to a property in the MoML).
        Returns:
        if true, register contents of parameter.
        Throws:
        RecordingException

      • regLink

        public boolean regLink(NamedObj endPoint1,
                       NamedObj endPoint2)
                throws RecordingException
        Register a link between two endpoints. Each endpoint must already be registered as a port or relation. NOTE: in ptII, a link can between a port and a relation, or between two relations.
        Parameters:
        endPoint1 - first endpoint.
        endPoint2 - second endpoint.
        Returns:
        if true, register contents of link.
        Throws:
        RecordingException

      • regPort

        public boolean regPort(TypedIOPort port)
                throws RecordingException
        Register a port or portparameter.
        Returns:
        if true, register contents of port.
        Throws:
        RecordingException

                            KeplerLSID oldLSID,

                     throws RecordingException
        A workflow was renamed.
        Parameters:

        oldName - the previous name
        newName - the new name

        RecordingException
